comments: Eric is a swell guy. There is not much work for this course, a homework every 2 weeks or so. They can be time consuming and you have to do the reading but they are graded generously. Only downside of this course was that it was 2.5 hours once a week, would prefer the time to be split up.

The homework was extremely vague and technical. This course was designed to be an into course for anyone who had no coding or neural knowledge. It was far from that. All of the materials were given at the end of class. The lectures only cover a fragment of what you need to do with the homework You know it\'s bad when google can\'t help you.

The homework and the class are two independent subjects. There is no syllabus, discussion board, online grade book, homework feedback, or any form of organization to this class. The homework is not posted online and the TA\'s do not have access to the homework unless you show them the copy you got in class.
His notes was not sufficient at all.
Dr. Shea-Brown did an amazing job of teaching me about nonlinear dynamical systems. Because of him I am a success today.

It is horrible teacher. Never take his class.He never respond to e-mail. very hard to be in touch with him. I think his T.A. are way better than him. I am surprised such a agood institution have him as a professor. Woa
He did not hold the specific office hour expcept 20-30 minutes after class. For students who need extra help on hw, the help was not prompt, presentations and handwrittn notes were too messy.
The presentation of material was very clear. Prof is open and helpful when it comes to questions, both in class and during office hours. Homeworks were tough but very educational.
He\'s helpful, answering questions, walking around the classroom, responding questions on emails and the Catalyst.
This class is quite easy; homeworks are assigned in about every two weeks, not very hard to finish. He is an easy and fair grader, I really like this! Overall, rate him 4.0.

Lectures are extremely messy, not really teach anything, huge waste. I don\'t think he cares how much you have learned, just wants to get paid. I wonder how long he has been hiding here at the UW. Jobs are shrinking at this time; kick him out of here.
hope never go to his class

The material in this class gets very complicated and can be pretty dry but Shea-Brown kept me awake. After he teaches us something, he goes \'okay who cares\', \'whatever\', or \'doesn\'t matter\'. He\'s just always saying something strange and comical. Seriously though, he seems to genuinely care about student questions and concerns.

All I (i guess he) have/has to say is "WHOOPS! According to Shea-Brown, everything is "good enough" even when the class is staring at disbelief at multitudes of variables intermixed in incomprehensible formulas. Gotta love the tight ponytail though! He likes to stand on chairs.

Enthusiastic guy that loves to holler "WHOOPS" when he messes up an example. Not a clear lecturer. Attending lecture is not helpful for homework yet is the only way to learn byhand methods for tests. Brutal
